history_of_present_illness: 45-year-old male with sharp chest pain for 2 days, rated 7/10, worsens with breathing and movement. Pain is positional, worse when lying flat.
past_medical_history: Hypertension for 5 years, high cholesterol, diabetes mellitus type 2
medications: Lisinopril 10mg daily, atorvastatin 20mg daily, metformin 500mg twice daily
physical_exam: BP 138/85, HR 78. Point tenderness over left sternal border. Heart sounds normal. Lungs clear bilaterally.
assessment: Costochondritis. Patient also has underlying coronary artery disease.
plan: Ibuprofen 400mg TID for pain. Rest and avoid aggravating activities. Follow up in 1 week. Return if symptoms worsen.
